definition: lit. newborn calves do not fear tigers (idiom)/fig. the young are fearless
pinyin: chu1 sheng1 niu2 du2 bu4 pa4 hu3

definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps

sentences.english: The saying is that a bobby calf doesn't fear a tiger.
sentences.chinese: 正所谓，初生牛犊不怕虎嘛。

sentences.english: Still, Liu warns, it's 'a baby calf who is not afraid of a tiger.
sentences.chinese: 但刘善文警告说，这是初生牛犊不怕虎。

sentences.english: The newborn calf fears not the tiger.

definition: venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
fearing nothing in Heaven or Earth (idiom)/fearless
pinyin: tian1 bu4 pa4 di4 bu4 pa4

definition: the young will be redoubtable in the years to come (idiom)/the younger generations will surpass us in time
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
not to know the immensity of heaven and earth/an exaggerated opinion of one's own abilities
pinyin: bu4 zhi1 tian1 gao1 di4 hou4

definition: to deserve praise for one's courage (idiom)
to exert all one's force/all-out effort/CL:股[gu3]
to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
